snippet: The state attorney general urged county clerks to use caution in issuing licenses on a day that a new lawsuit was filed by a Santa Fe couple.
abstract: New Mexico attorney general Gary King, under pressure from legislators and vigorous campaign by religious and civil rights groups to legalize same-sex marriage, cautions city clerks against issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples; at same time, invites litigation, saying state's statue is 'vulnerable to challenge;' couple Alexander Hanna and Yon Hudson file suit against Santa Fe County for denying them marriage license.
lead_paragraph: The state attorney general urged county clerks to use caution in issuing licenses on a day that a new lawsuit was filed by a Santa Fe couple.

headline.seo: With New Legal Challenge, Gay Marriage Debate in New Mexico Heats Up
headline.main: With New Legal Challenge, Gay Marriage Debate in New Mexico Heats Up
headline.print_headline: With New Legal Challenge, Gay Marriage Debate in New Mexico Heats Up
